column4: hey guys I'm having some wicked dual boot problems- i have 2 hard drives and i installed ubuntu on one of them, winxp is on the other.
everything was fine, i logged into win xp once
and now i try to go to ubuntu and it dies quickly
what do you mean by it "dies"
mount: Mounting /dev/hda1 on /root failed: Invalid argument.  mount: mounting /root/dev on /dev/static/dev failed: No such file or directory
and i get kicked out to this funky shell with only a few commands, and being a newb i'm confused.
google searches seemed to make it look like it may just be the wrong commands- i only ran xp from a grub command line, not the actual grub menu.
so i thought maybe i screwed up something when i said map (hd0) (hd1) and then after map (hd1) (hd0) to boot xp
i just hadn't done any xp stuff yet
odd... do you run any programs on windows that might have effected your linux disks?
DBO- no I don't think so
is there anything i can do from this goofy busybox built in shell to figure out what drives have what?
you need someone more awake than me... sorry I figured this would be a standard run of the mill problem, but you found yourself a genuine issue
